<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" BGCOLOR="#CFF0FC" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;WIDTH:66.98%; BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE 2.5PT TRANSPARENT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:13.7PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Total operating expenses
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CFF0FC" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;WIDTH:1.62%; BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE 2.5PT TRANSPARENT;">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CFF0FC" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PT;WIDTH:1%; BORDER-TOP:SOLID 0.75PT #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE 2.5PT #000000;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	$
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CFF0FC" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PT;WIDTH:12.88%; BORDER-TOP:SOLID 0.75PT #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE 2.5PT #000000;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	80,624
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CFF0FC" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;WIDTH:1%; BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE 2.5PT TRANSPARENT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CFF0FC" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;WIDTH:1.62%; BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE 2.5PT TRANSPARENT;">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CFF0FC" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PT;WIDTH:1%; BORDER-TOP:SOLID 0.75PT #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE 2.5PT #000000;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	$
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CFF0FC" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PT;WIDTH:12.88%; BORDER-TOP:SOLID 0.75PT #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE 2.5PT #000000;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	50,710
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CFF0FC" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;WIDTH:1%; BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE 2.5PT TRANSPARENT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:1PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:2PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	SG&amp;A increased by $29.9&#160;million for the year ended December&#160;31, 2015, compared to the same period in 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;The increase is due to a $30.3&#160;million goodwill impairment charge recorded in 2015 compared to a similar charge in 2014 of $981,000.&nbsp;&nbsp;The 2015 goodwill impairment charge is attributable to our Wholesale segment and was recorded because management concluded in 2015 that the segment&#8217;s book value for its U.S. operations exceeded its corresponding fair value.&nbsp;&nbsp;Selling expenses increased during 2015 compared to 2014 due to increased internet support costs necessary to support the growth of Acorn TV.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our general and administrative expenses continued to decrease as a result of our efforts to reduce overhead and related costs despite a slight increase in severance charges, which were $574,000 and $548,000 for 2015 and 2014, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:18PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Equity Earnings of Affiliate
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Equity earnings of affiliate (which is ACL) decreased $363,000 for the year ended December 31, 2015 to $2.2 million compared to 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;During 2015, ACL generated lower gross margins (revenues less film cost amortization) when compared to 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;ACL recognized increased revenues in 2015 resulting from two new releases (
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Partners in Crime
</FONT>
	and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	And Then There were None
</FONT>
	), but these increased revenues generated low margins as the initial broadcasters did not exercise their options for a second season.&nbsp;&nbsp;Previous to these 2015 releases, ACL latest releases were in 2013, which realized better gross margins and disproportionally benefited 2014 when compared to 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;ACL is in process of completing the production of another made-for-television movie, which has not yet been released.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	31
</P>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS;WIDTH:100%;">
<A NAME="eolPage32"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:18PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<A NAME="RLJE-10K_20151231_HTM__AEIOULASTRENDEREDPAGEBREAKAEIOU31">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Interest Expense
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Interest expense for the year ended December 31, 2015 was $10.0 million compared to $9.6 million for the same period in 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest expense increased $353,000 during the current year due to an increased average debt balance owed under our Credit Agreement in 2015 as compared to 2014, and an increased interest rate payable (currently LIBOR plus 10.64%) when compared to the prior credit facility (which was approximately LIBOR plus 7.0%).&nbsp;&nbsp;At the time the prior credit facility was refinanced in September 2014, the balance due was $55.7 million.&nbsp;&nbsp;Once refinanced, the balance due increased to $70.0&#160;million.&nbsp;&nbsp;On April&#160;15, 2015, we made an accelerated debt payment of $10.0&#160;million.&nbsp;&nbsp;During 2015, we also made quarterly principal payments on our Credit Agreement of $613,000 each.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:18PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Change in Fair Value of Stock Warrants and Other Derivatives
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The change in the fair value of our stock warrants and other derivative liabilities impacts the statement of operations.&nbsp;&nbsp;A decrease in the fair value of the liabilities results in the recognition of income, while an increase in the fair value of the liabilities results in the recognition of expense.&nbsp;&nbsp;Changes in fair value are primarily driven by changes in our common stock price and its volatility.&nbsp;&nbsp;For the years ended December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, the fair value of our stock warrants and other derivative liabilities decreased by $1.4&#160;million and $3.5 million, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Loss on Extinguishment of Debt
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	When entering into the new Credit Agreement, we recognized a loss on extinguishment of debt of $1.5&#160;million in the third quarter of 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;The loss primarily represents the expensing of unamortized debt discounts and deferred financing costs associated with the prior credit facility.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Other Expense
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Other expense mostly consists of foreign currency gains and losses resulting primarily from advances and loans by our U.S. subsidiaries to our foreign subsidiaries that have not yet been repaid.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our foreign currency gains and losses are primarily impacted by changes in the exchange rate of the British Pound Sterling (or
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	the Pound
</FONT>
	) relative to the U.S. dollar (or the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Dollar
</FONT>
	).&nbsp;&nbsp;As the Pound strengthens relative to the Dollar, we recognized other income; and as the Pound weakens relative to the Dollar, we recognize other expense.&nbsp;&nbsp;During 2015 and 2014, the Pound weakened relative to the dollar and we recognized foreign currency losses of $1.1&#160;million each year.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:18PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Income Taxes
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	We have fully reserved our net U.S. deferred tax assets, and such tax assets may be available to reduce future income taxes payable should we have U.S. taxable income in the future. To the extent such deferred tax assets relate to net operating losses (or
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	NOL
</FONT>
	) carryforwards, the ability to use our NOL carryforwards against future earnings will be subject to applicable carryforward periods and limitations subsequent to a change in ownership.&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December&#160;31, 2015, we had NOL carryforwards for federal and state income tax purposes of approximately $87.3&#160;million and approximately $59.6&#160;million, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	We recorded income tax expense of $165,000 and $399,000 for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our tax provision consists primarily of a deferred tax provision for certain deferred tax liabilities and a current tax provision for our U.K. operations.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are recording a deferred tax provision and liability for our equity earnings of affiliate (ACL).&nbsp;&nbsp;These earnings will be taxable in the U.K., when and if we dispose of our investment.&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2015, we also reversed a previously recognized deferred liability related to goodwill amortization that was being provided for tax purposes.&nbsp;&nbsp;Because of the goodwill impairment recognized, the deferred liability was reversed and is no longer being recognized for financial statement purposes.&nbsp;&nbsp;This reversal resulted in us reducing our tax expense in 2015 by $411,000.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are providing current income tax expense on pre-tax income from our consolidated U.K. subsidiaries at an effective tax rate of approximately 20%.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are not providing a current tax provision (benefit) on our U.S. operations, other than for certain state minimum taxes, which are immaterial.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Adjusted EBITDA
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<A NAME="RLJE-10K_20151231_HTM__AEIOULASTRENDEREDPAGEBREAKAEIOU32">
</A>
	Management believes Adjusted EBITDA to be a meaningful indicator of our performance that provides useful information to investors regarding our financial condition and results of operations because it removes material non-cash items that allows investors to analyze the operating performance of the business using the same metric management uses.&nbsp;&nbsp;The exclusion of non-cash items better reflects our ability to make investments in the business and meet obligations.&nbsp;&nbsp;Presentation of Adjusted EBITDA is a non-GAAP financial measure commonly used in the entertainment industry and by financial analysts and others who follow the industry to measure operating performance.&nbsp;&nbsp;Management uses this measure to assess operating results and performance of our business, perform analytical comparisons, identify strategies to improve performance and allocate resources to our business segments. While
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	32
</P>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS;WIDTH:100%;">
<A NAME="eolPage33"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	management considers Adjusted EBITDA to be an important measure of comparative operating performance, it should be considered in addition to, but not as a substitute for, net income and other measures of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	financial performance reported in accordance with US GAAP. Not all companies calculate Adjusted EBITDA in the same manner and the measure, as presented, may not be comparable to similarly-titled measures presented by other companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The following table includes the reconciliation of our consolidated U.S. GAAP net loss to our consolidated Adjusted EBITDA:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#160;
</P>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">

<TD COLSPAN="6" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PT;WIDTH:30.38%; BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID 0.75PT #000000;">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Years Ended
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	December 31,
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;WIDTH:1%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;WIDTH:66.98%; BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID 0.75PT TRANSPARENT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	(In thousands)

<P STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:2PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	During 2015, we started adding back basis-difference amortization in equity earnings when computing Adjusted EBITDA.&nbsp;&nbsp;For comparability purposes, we made this adjustment retroactively for 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;Adjusted EBITDA decreased by $2.0&#160;million for the year ended December&#160;31, 2015 compared to the same period in 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;The decrease is primarily driven by lower revenues from our IP Licensing segment and lower equity earnings of affiliate.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	A reconciliation of Adjusted EBITDA to our net cash (used in) provided by operating activities as reported in our consolidated statements of cash flows is as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#160;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	BALANCE SHEET ANALYSIS
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Assets
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<A NAME="RLJE-10K_20151231_HTM__AEIOULASTRENDEREDPAGEBREAKAEIOU33">
</A>
	Total assets at December 31, 2015 and 2014, were $151.5&#160;million and $192.1&#160;million, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;The decline of $40.6&#160;million in assets is mostly attributed to (i) the goodwill impairment of $30.3&#160;million, (ii) amortization of other intangible assets of $5.0&#160;million, (iii) a decline in investments in content of $7.1&#160;million, which is due to the amortization from the Business Combination&#8217;s fair value adjustments of $5.0 million and impairments of $3.2&#160;million, (iv) a decline in inventories of $2.3&#160;million as customers continue to shift from physical consumption (DVD and Blue-ray) to digital (VOD and streaming), and (v) a decline in our equity investment in ACL of $2.2&#160;million.&nbsp;&nbsp;The decline in our equity investment is due to a combination of dividends paid of $3.3&#160;million being greater than our share of net income from ACL of $2.2&#160;million and a weakening Pound compared to the Dollar.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	33
</P>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS;WIDTH:100%;">
<A NAME="eolPage34"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Offsetting these declines is an increase in accounts receivable of $7.6&#160;million, which is due to a shift in our title releases for 2015 whereby more content was released in the fourth quarter this yea
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	r compared to the same period last year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	A summary of assets by segment is as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#160;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:8PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Liabilities and Equity
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The decline of liabilities and equity of $40.6&#160;million is mostly attributed to the net loss of $55.0&#160;million for the year ended December 31, 2015 that is included in accumulated deficit, offset by $12.5 million that is related to the issuance of preferred stock and warrants.&nbsp;&nbsp;On May 20, 2015, we issued preferred stock and warrants for $31.0 million and concurrently reduced our debt obligations by $18.5 million, which consists of an accelerated principal payment of $10.0 million and $8.5 million of converted subordinated debt.
</P>
</EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:2PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	At December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, our cash and cash equivalents were approximately $4.5 million and $6.7&#160;million, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended December&#160;31, 2015, our cash position was impacted by the following:
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	We incurred a net use of cash of $9.2&#160;million resulting from our operating activities.&nbsp;&nbsp;The net use of cash was largely attributable to a net increase (or investment) in working capital of $10.2&#160;million.&nbsp;&nbsp;During 2015, our accounts receivables increased by $7.9&#160;million due to a shift in our title releases for 2015 whereby more content was released in the fourth quarter this year compared to the same period last year.&nbsp;&nbsp;We continue to have significant short-term vendor debts, which are past due and which we are in the process of paying off by making increased cash payments or modifying payment terms in the short term.&nbsp;&nbsp;Bringing our vendor trade payables current continues to constrain our liquidity. During 2015, our accounts payable and accrued liabilities decreased by $921,000.&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2014, we were able to reduce accounts payable and accrued liabilities by $7.8&#160;million.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	Our quarterly results are typically affected by:&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) the timing and release dates of key productions, (b) the seasonality of our Wholesale and Direct-to-Consumer business which are 32% to 35% weighted to the fourth quarter and (c) we generally invest more cash on content during the first half of the year.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The aggregate cash used in operating activities during the year ended December&#160;31, 2015 was provided by our financing activities and our cash reserves as of December 31, 2014, offset by cash used in investing activities.&nbsp;&nbsp;For the year ended December&#160;31, 2015, significant factors affecting cash provided by or used in our investing and financing activities were:
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">

	&#183;

</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	We received gross cash proceeds of $22.5 million by issuing preferred stock and warrants to purchase shares of common stock.&nbsp;&nbsp;We used the proceeds to make accelerated principal payments of $10.0&#160;million under our Credit Agreement as discussed below.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	34
</P>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS;WIDTH:100%;">
<A NAME="eolPage35"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A NAME="RLJE-10K_20151231_HTM__AEIOULASTRENDEREDPAGEBREAKAEIOU34">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	Made quarterly principal payments under our Credit Agreement totaling $2.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	Made capital expenditures of $1.8&#160;million.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	We continue to experience liquidity constraints as we have several competing demands on our available cash and cash that may be generated from operations.&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&#160;We continue to have significant past-due vendor payables, which currently exceed $12.0&#160;million.&nbsp;&nbsp;These past-due payables are largely a result of significant past-due vendor payables acquired in 2012 when purchasing Image.&nbsp;&nbsp;As we work to catch up on the acquired past-due payables, we have fallen behind on other payables.&nbsp;&nbsp;We continue to work with our vendors to make payment arrangements that are agreeable with them and that give us flexibility in terms of when payments will be made.&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&#160;We are forecasting that we may need to make an accelerated principal payment, which may be significant, on our senior debt during the fourth quarter of 2016 in order to meet our bank covenants.&nbsp;&nbsp;This is because our bank covenants become more restrictive during the fourth quarter of 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;For example, our senior debt-to-Adjusted EBITDA ratio goes from 4:03&#160;:&#160;1:00 currently to 2:67&#160;:&#160;1:00.&nbsp;&nbsp;For us to meet these more restrictive bank covenants, we will need to improve our Adjusted EBITDA and/or pay down our senior debt balance.&nbsp;&nbsp;(3)&#160;We must maintain a certain level of content spend necessary to acquire new content that allows us to generate the revenues and margins necessary to meet our obligations.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	To help address our liquidity risk, on May&#160;20, 2015, we completed a $31.0&#160;million capital restructuring transaction that addressed two fundamental areas: (a)&#160;deleveraging the balance sheet and (b)&#160;providing new working capital.&nbsp;&nbsp;As part of the capital restructure, we amended our credit agreement and other notes payable by (i)&#160;reducing our minimum cash requirement by $2.5&#160;million, thus making this cash available for operational needs, (ii)&#160;modifying certain short-term financial covenants to maintain compliance and (iii)&#160;amending our unsecured subordinated seller notes to convert 50% or $8.5 million of the outstanding principal and accrued interest into preferred stock and warrants and reduce the applicable interest rate from 12.0% to 1.5% on the remaining balance through 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;The capital restructure improved our liquidity by selling shares of preferred stock and warrants for a total of $31.0&#160;million ($22.5&#160;million in cash and $8.5&#160;million in converted subordinated notes).&nbsp;&nbsp;The proceeds received were used to make an accelerated principal payment of $10.0&#160;million under our credit agreement and pay fees and expenses incurred of approximately $1.9&#160;million.&nbsp;&nbsp;The remaining $10.6&#160;million was available for content investment and working capital needs.&nbsp;&nbsp;By reducing our debt balances and the applicable interest rate on the unsecured subordinated seller notes for two years, our future, annual cash interest expense has been reduced by approximately $2.0&#160;million.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	We have taken actions to improve our operating results and Adjusted EBITDA in 2016 by exiting certain non-core operations that have been generating losses.&nbsp;&nbsp;During December 2015, we approved and started implementing a plan to close our Acacia catalog operations, which incurred an operating loss of $4.0 million in 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are also exploring various financing alternatives, which includes raising additional capital and/or refinancing our existing senior debt.&nbsp;&nbsp;There can be no assurances that we will be able to secure additional capital or be able to refinance our senior debt.&nbsp;&nbsp;While our ability to meet our commitments is not dependent upon these efforts, if we were to complete one of these transactions, it would help to address our liquidity risk.&nbsp;&nbsp;We believe that our current financial position combined with our 2016 forecasted operational results and management efforts will be sufficient to meet our commitments.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, there can be no assurances that we will be successful in achieving our 2016 forecasted operational results, generating sufficient cash flows from operations necessary to meet our future covenant requirements, or agreeing with vendors on revised payment terms.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	If we are able to raise additional funds through the issuance of securities convertible into or exercisable for common stock, the percentage ownership of our stockholders may be significantly diluted, and these newly issued securities may have rights, preferences or privileges senior to those of existing common stockholders.&nbsp;&nbsp;Market and industry factors may harm the market price of our common stock and may adversely impact our ability to raise additional funds. Similarly, if our common stock is delisted from the NASDAQ Capital Market, it may limit our ability to raise additional funds.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Capital Resources
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:4.54%;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Cash
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	As of December&#160;31, 2015, we had cash of $4.5 million, as compared to $6.7&#160;million as of December&#160;31, 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:4.54%;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Senior Term Notes
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<A NAME="RLJE-10K_20151231_HTM__AEIOULASTRENDEREDPAGEBREAKAEIOU35">
</A>
	On September 11, 2014, we entered into a $70.0 million Credit and Guaranty Agreement (the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Credit Agreement
</FONT>
	) with a syndicate of lenders led by McLarty Capital Partners, as administrative agent.&nbsp;&nbsp;On April 15, 2015, we entered into an agreement with the lenders to amend the Credit Agreement whereby (i) the interest rate was increased to LIBOR plus 10.64%, (ii) certain financial statement and other reporting and lending communication requirements were modified, (iii)&#160;certain financial covenants were made less restrictive for the quarters ended March 31, 2015 and June 30, 3015, (iv) the Minimum Cash Balance (as defined in the Credit Agreement) that we are required to maintain was lowered to $1.0&#160;million, and (v) the lenders consented to the issuance of preferred
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	35
</P>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS;WIDTH:100%;">
<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	stock and warrants (see
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Preferred Stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	below)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The Credit Agreement consists of a term loan totaling $70.0&#160;million with a maturity of five years, at an interest rate equal to LIBOR plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	10.64
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	%.&nbsp;&nbsp;LIBOR has
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	a floor of 0.25%.&nbsp;&nbsp;Principal payment obligations as a percentage of the amount initially borrowed are 3.5% per annum paid quarterly for the first two years, 5.0% for the third year and 7.5% for the remaining term with any unpaid principal balance due at m
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	aturity.&nbsp;&nbsp;The obligations under the Credit Agreement are secured by a lien on substantially all of our consolidated assets pursuant to the Pledge and Security Agreement, dated as of September&#160;11, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Under the Credit Agreement, interest and principal is payable quarterly with principal payments beginning on December&#160;31, 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;Beginning in 2016, we are obligated to make certain accelerated principal payments annually which are contingent upon: (1)&#160;the occurrence of consolidated excess cash flows, as defined in the Credit Agreement and (2) only to the extent at which such excess cash flows are above our minimum cash threshold of $12.0&#160;million.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are permitted to make additional voluntary principal payments under the Credit Agreement, but prepayments are subject to an applicable prepayment premium of:&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) 5% if prepaid the first year, (b) 3% if prepaid during the second year and (c) 1.5% if prepaid during the third year.&nbsp;&nbsp;The first $5.0&#160;million of voluntary prepayment is not subject to any prepayment premium.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The Credit Agreement contains certain financial and non-financial covenants beginning on December 31, 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial covenants are assessed quarterly and are based on Adjusted EBITDA, as defined in the Credit Agreement.&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial covenants vary each quarter and generally become more restrictive over time.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Financial covenants include the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#160;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_26"></A>
<DIV>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;WIDTH:48.52%; BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID 0.75PT TRANSPARENT;">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;WIDTH:1.26%; BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID 0.75PT TRANSPARENT;">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	1.59 : 1.00

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:2PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	We are also obligated to maintain a minimum valuation ratio computed on the outstanding principal balance of our senior debt compared to the sum of our valuations of our content library and our investment in ACL.&nbsp;&nbsp;To the extent the valuation ratio exceeds the allowed threshold; we are obligated to make an additional principal payment such that the threshold would not be exceeded after giving effect to this payment.&nbsp;&nbsp;The valuation threshold is 83% as long as the unpaid principal balance exceeds $65.0&#160;million and 75% thereafter.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The Credit Agreement contains events of default that include, among others, non-payment of principal, interest or fees, violation of covenants, inaccuracy of representations and warranties, bankruptcy and insolvency events, material judgments, cross defaults to certain other contracts (including, for example, business arrangements with our U.S. distribution facilitation partner and other material contracts) and indebtedness and events constituting a change of control or a material adverse effect in any of our results of operations or conditions (financial or otherwise).&nbsp;&nbsp;The occurrence of an event of default would increase the applicable rate of interest and could result in the acceleration of our obligations under the Credit Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The Credit Agreement imposes restrictions on such items as encumbrances and liens, payments of dividends, other indebtedness, stock repurchases, capital expenditures and entering into new lease obligations.&nbsp;&nbsp;Additional covenants restrict our ability to make certain investments, such as loans and equity investments, or investments in content that are not in the ordinary course of business.&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant to the amended Credit Agreement, we must maintain at all times a cash balance of $1.0&#160;million.&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December&#160;31, 2015, we were in compliance with all covenants as stipulated in the amended Credit Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	In connection with the sale of preferred stock and warrants, we used $10.0&#160;million of the cash proceeds to make partial payment on the Credit Agreement and approximately $1.9&#160;million for prepayment penalties, legal and accounting fees and other expenses associated with the transaction.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	36
</P>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS;WIDTH:100%;">
<A NAME="eolPage37"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:18PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:4.54%;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<A NAME="RLJE-10K_20151231_HTM__AEIOULASTRENDEREDPAGEBREAKAEIOU36">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Subordinated Notes Payable
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Upon consummation of the Business Combination, we issued unsecured subordinated promissory notes in the aggregate principal amount of $14.8&#160;million to the selling preferred stockholders of Image (or
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Subordinated Note Holders
</FONT>
	).&nbsp;&nbsp;The subordinated promissory notes mature on the earlier of October 3, 2018 or six months after the latest stated maturity of the senior debt issued pursuant to the Credit Agreement.&nbsp;&nbsp;The unsecured subordinated promissory notes currently bear an interest rate of 1.5% per annum, of which 45% is payable in cash annually and the balance is accrued and added to the principal, which is payable upon maturity.&nbsp;&nbsp;During the second quarter of 2014, interest was due of $992,000 and added to the principal balance of these notes and the remainder was paid to the debt holders.&nbsp;&nbsp;At December 31, 2014, our principal balance due pursuant to these notes was $16.0&#160;million.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	On April&#160;15, 2015, we entered into an agreement to amend the subordinated promissory notes (the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Note Amendment
</FONT>
	) that were issued to the Subordinated Note Holders.&nbsp;&nbsp;The principal terms of the Note Amendment are as follows:
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>

	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	(a)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	an agreement by the Subordinated Note Holders to convert 50% of the outstanding balance under the subordinated notes into shares of preferred stock and warrants;
</P>
</TD>

</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	(b)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	amendments to the subordinated notes (i) changing the interest rate payable from 12% to 1.5% per annum for the 24&#8209;month period commencing on January 1, 2015, and then 12% per annum thereafter; and (ii)&#160;specifying that 45% of the interest due will be payable in cash and the remainder of the accrued interest will be payable in the form of additional subordinated notes; and
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">

	&nbsp;

</TD>

	(c)

</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	a waiver of any existing defaults and events of default.
</P>
</TD>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	In connection with the sale of preferred stock and warrants, the Subordinated Note Holders exchanged approximately $8.5&#160;million of Subordinated Notes for 8,546 shares of preferred stock and 2,564,000 warrants.&nbsp;&nbsp;At December&#160;31, 2015, our principal balance due pursuant to these notes was $8.5&#160;million.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:18PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:4.54%;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Preferred Stock
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	On May 20, 2015, we closed a transaction in which we sold 31,046 shares of preferred stock and warrants to acquire 9,313,873 shares of common stock for $22.5 million in cash and the exchange of $8.5 million in subordinated notes.&nbsp;&nbsp;Of the preferred shares and warrants sold, 16,500 shares of preferred stock and warrants to acquire 4,950,000 shares of common stock were sold to certain board members or their affiliated companies.&nbsp;&nbsp;We used $10.0 million of the cash proceeds from this sale to make partial payment on our Credit Agreement and approximately $1.9 million for prepayment penalties, legal and accounting fees, which included fees associated with our registration statement filed in July 2015 and other expenses associated with the transaction.&nbsp;&nbsp;The balance of the net cash proceeds was used for content investment and working capital purposes.&nbsp;&nbsp;Of the fees incurred, $878,000 was recorded against the proceeds received, $450,000 was recorded as additional debt discounts, $250,000 was included as interest expense and the balance was included in other expense.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The preferred stock has the following rights and preferences:
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	Rank
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	&#8211; the preferred stock ranks higher than other company issued equity securities in terms of distributions, dividends and other payments upon liquidation.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
