<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:10.27%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Note 4.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	EQUITY EARNINGS OF AFFILIATE
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	In February 2012, Acorn Media acquired a 64% interest in ACL for total purchase consideration of &#163;13.7 million or approximately $21.9 million excluding direct transaction costs.&nbsp;&nbsp;The acquisition gave Acorn Media a majority ownership of ACL&#8217;s extensive works including a variety of short story collections, more than 80 novels, 19 plays and a film library of over 100 made-for-television films.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	We account for our investment in ACL using the equity method of accounting because (1) Acorn Media is only entitled to appoint one-half of ACL&#8217;s board members and (2) in the event the board is deadlocked, the chairman of the board, who is appointed by the directors elected by the minority shareholders, casts a deciding vote.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	61
</P>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS;WIDTH:100%;">
<A NAME="eolPage62"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<A NAME="RLJE-10K_20151231_HTM__AEIOULASTRENDEREDPAGEBREAKAEIOU60">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	As of the Business Combination, our 64% share of the difference between ACL&#8217;s fair value and the amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	underlying equity in ACL&#8217;s net assets was approximately $18.7 million.&nbsp;&nbsp;This step-up basis difference is primarily attributable to the fair value of ACL&#8217;s copyrights, which expire in 2046.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are amortizing the basis difference through 2046 using the stra
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	ight-line method.&nbsp;&nbsp;Basis difference amortization is recorded against our share of ACL&#8217;s net income in our consolidated statements of operations; however this amortization is not included within ACL&#8217;s financial statements.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	A summary of the ACL investment account is as follows:

<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:2PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Balance sheet amounts have been translated from the GBP to U.S. dollar using the December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014 exchange rates.&nbsp;&nbsp;Income statement amounts have been translated from the GBP to U.S. dollar using the average exchange rate for each of the years presented.
</P>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">

	Note 5.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A NAME="RLJE-10K_20151231_HTM__AEIOULASTRENDEREDPAGEBREAKAEIOU61">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Accounts Receivable
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Accounts receivable are primarily derived from:&nbsp;&nbsp;(1) the sale of physical content (DVDs) to retailers and wholesale distributors who ship to mass retail, (2) direct-to-consumer, e-commerce, catalog and download-to-own sales and (3) video content we license to broadcast, cable/satellite providers and digital subscription platforms like Netflix and Amazon.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our accounts receivable typically trends with retail seasonality.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#160;
</P>

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" BGCOLOR="#CFF0FC" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;WIDTH:1.62%; BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE 2.5PT TRANSPARENT;">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CFF0FC" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PT;WIDTH:1%; BORDER-TOP:SOLID 0.75PT #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE 2.5PT #000000;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	$
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CFF0FC" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PT;WIDTH:12.88%; BORDER-TOP:SOLID 0.75PT #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE 2.5PT #000000;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	17,389
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CFF0FC" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;WIDTH:1%; BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE 2.5PT TRANSPARENT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:1PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:2PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Wholesale receivables include amounts billed by our U.S. distribution facilitation partner, SPHE.&nbsp;&nbsp;Each quarter, our distribution partner preliminarily settles our wholesale receivables assuming a timing lag on collections and an average-return rate.&nbsp;&nbsp;When actual returns differ from the amounts previously assumed, adjustments are made that give rise to payables and receivables between us and our distribution partner.&nbsp;&nbsp;Amounts vary and tend to be seasonal following our sales activity.&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December&#160;31, 2015, our distribution partner owed us $826,000 for receivables settled as of year-end; and as of December&#160;31, 2014, we owed our distribution partner $3.1&#160;million for receivables settled as of year-end.&nbsp;&nbsp;The wholesale receivables are reported net of amounts owed to the distribution partner as amounts are offset against each other when settling.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	As of December 31, 2015 and 2014, the net wholesale receivables with our distribution partner were $11.1&#160;million and $6.6&#160;million respectively, which is included in accounts receivable.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Our Direct-to-Consumer receivable represents amounts due to us from our merchant bank related to our credit card transactions processed as of year-end.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:2PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>

<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:2PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Other merchandise consists of third-party products, primarily gifts, jewelry and home accents.
</P>
</TD>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	For each reporting period, we review the value of inventories on hand to estimate the recoverability through future sales.&nbsp;&nbsp;Values in excess of anticipated future sales are booked as obsolescence reserve.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our obsolescence reserve was $11.4 million and $11.1&#160;million as of December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. We reduce our inventories with adjustments for lower of cost or market valuation, shrinkage, excess quantities and obsolescence.&nbsp;&nbsp;During the years ended December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, we recorded impairment charges of $1.6 million and $2.4 million, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;These charges are included in cost of sales as manufacturing and fulfillment cost.
</P>

	63

	During the years ended December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, we recorded no impairment to property, equipment and improvements.&nbsp;&nbsp;Depreciation expense was $917,000 for the year ended December&#160;31, 2015 and $878,000 for the year ended December&#160;31, 2014.

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:2PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Investments in content are stated at the lower of unamortized cost or estimated fair value. The valuation of investments in content is reviewed on a title-by-title basis when an event or change in circumstances indicates that the fair value of content is less than its unamortized cost.&nbsp;&nbsp;Impairment charges for the years ended December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014 were $3.2 million and $4.8 million, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;Impairments are included in cost of sales as part of content amortization and royalties.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	In determining the fair value of content (Note 15,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Fair Value Measurements
</FONT>
	), we employ a discounted cash flows (or
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	DCF
</FONT>
	) methodology.&nbsp;&nbsp;Key inputs employed in the DCF methodology include estimates of ultimate revenue and costs, as well as a discount rate.&nbsp;&nbsp;The discount rate utilized in the DCF analysis is based on a market participant&#8217;s weighted average cost of capital plus a risk premium representing the risk associated with producing a particular type of content.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Our estimated future amortization for investments in content is as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#160;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:2PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Of the goodwill recognized, approximately $21.4 million will be amortized over 15 years for tax purposes giving rise to a future tax deduction.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Goodwill was tested for impairment for the periods presented and we recognized impairment losses of $30.3 million in our Wholesale segment during 2015 and $981,000 in our Direct-to-Consumer segment during 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	During the fourth quarter of 2015, our Wholesale segment performance, primarily in the U.S., was below its forecast for the quarter.&nbsp;&nbsp;Also, during this quarter, we adjusted our 2016 forecast downward to reflect our continued liquidity constraints and the impact these constraints have had on our ability to invest in future content.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our ability to increase our investments in future content will continue to be hindered in the near term by accelerated principal reduction payments that may be necessary in 2016 (see
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Liquidity
</FONT>
	in Note 1,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Description of Business
</FONT>
	).&nbsp;&nbsp;We considered these decreases to be a triggering event and hired a valuation firm to fair value our U.S. Wholesale reporting unit, which held the majority of our goodwill.&nbsp;&nbsp;The valuation firm valued our U.S. Wholesale reporting unit using both the market approach (by using comparable businesses) and the income approach.&nbsp;&nbsp;Significant inputs were the selection of comparable companies, our five-year forecast and a risk-appropriate discount rate of 18%.&nbsp;&nbsp;The results of the valuation were that our U.S. Wholesale reporting unit had a fair value that was less than its carrying value, primarily because the unit held $38.9 million of recorded goodwill.&nbsp;&nbsp;Management assessed the amount of implied goodwill within this reporting unit and concluded that $30.3&#160;million of its goodwill was impaired.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	During the fourth quarter of 2014, the stock price of our publicly traded common stock decreased by 48% and our Direct-to-Consumer segment recognized lower revenue during the quarter compared to prior year&#8217;s fourth quarter.&nbsp;&nbsp;Given the magnitude of these decreases, we considered these to be triggering events and hired a valuation firm to fair value our reporting units that held the majority of our goodwill.&nbsp;&nbsp;The valuation firm fair valued our reporting units using both the market approach (by using comparable businesses) and the income approach.&nbsp;&nbsp;Significant inputs were the selection of comparable companies, our five-year forecast and a risk-appropriate discount rate of 18%.&nbsp;&nbsp;The results of the valuations were that only our Direct-to-Consumer segment in the UK had a carrying book value in excess of its fair value.&nbsp;&nbsp;Management assessed the amount of implied goodwill within this reporting unit and concluded that its goodwill was fully impaired.&nbsp;&nbsp;The goodwill that remains in our Direct-to-Consumer segment is associated with our proprietary SVOD channels.
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:1PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:2PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Amortization expense for the years ended December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014 was $5.0 million and $4.8 million, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;Costs incurred to develop, upgrade or enhance functionality of websites are capitalized while website operating costs are expensed as incurred.&nbsp;&nbsp;During the years ended December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, we capitalized $548,000 and $437,000 of costs related to our websites, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	During the third quarter of 2015, we committed to using the RLJE brand for all new feature-film content.&nbsp;&nbsp;We will continue to brand all previously released feature-film content with the Image brand.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result of this change, we reassessed the useful life of our Image brand and concluded that the brand's life had been reduced to a trailing eight-year period, with a disproportionate amount of brand benefit being realized during the first three years.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result, we changed our amortization assumptions.&nbsp;&nbsp;We were amortizing the carrying value of our Image trade name on a straight-line basis over 15 years, with 12 years remaining.&nbsp;&nbsp;Now we are amortizing the carrying value of our Image trade name over the remaining eight years with increased amortization in the earlier years.&nbsp;&nbsp;We recognized $463,000 of accelerated amortization during 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;The change will result in increased amortization expense through 2019, and then reduced amortization expense thereafter, as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CFF0FC" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PT;WIDTH:1%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CFF0FC" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PT;WIDTH:12.38%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	(1,124
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CFF0FC" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PT;WIDTH:1%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	)
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	We assessed whether the Image brand was impaired during 2015 and concluded that the estimated future cash flows from the Image brand exceed the brand&#8217;s carrying value; therefore we did not recognize an impairment charge.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	During the fourth quarter of 2015, we committed to and began implementing a plan to exit our Acacia catalog business (see Note 3,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Segment Information
</FONT>
	).&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result, we re-assessed the recoverability and the remaining useful life of our Acacia brand and recognized $842,000 of accelerated amortization during 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;When reaching this conclusion, we considered the future revenues forecasted from this brand and an appropriate royalty rate that would be owed had we not owned the brand.&nbsp;&nbsp;This charge effectively reduced the carrying value of this brand name asset to zero.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	During the year ended December 31, 2015, as a result of the changes in estimates related to the accelerated amortization of trade names, our loss from operations and net loss each increased by a total of $1.3 million and our basic and diluted loss per share increased by $0.10.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	66
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:2PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The subordinated notes mature in 2018 and the senior notes mature in 2019; however, if we do not subsequently extend the subordinated debt maturity, then the new senior notes&#8217; maturity would accelerate in conjunction with the repayment of the subordinated notes in 2018.&nbsp;&nbsp;The above table reflects the assumption that no extension of the subordinated notes occurs.&nbsp;&nbsp;The senior notes&#8217; minimum principal payments in 2018 would be $5.3&#160;million if the senior notes&#8217; maturity is not accelerated.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:18PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Senior Term Notes
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<A NAME="RLJE-10K_20151231_HTM__AEIOULASTRENDEREDPAGEBREAKAEIOU66">
</A>
	On September 11, 2014, we entered into a $70.0 million Credit and Guaranty Agreement (the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Credit Agreement
</FONT>
	) with a syndicate of lenders led by McLarty Capital Partners, as administrative agent.&nbsp;&nbsp;On April 15, 2015, we entered into an agreement with the lenders to amend the Credit Agreement whereby (i) the interest rate was increased to LIBOR plus 10.64%, (ii) certain financial statement and other reporting and lending communication requirements were modified, (iii) certain financial covenants were made less restrictive for the quarters ended March 31, 2015 and June 30, 3015, (iv) the Minimum Cash Balance (as defined in the Credit Agreement) that we are required to maintain was lowered to $1.0&#160;million, (v)&#160;the lender waived an event of default as our cash balance was below the Minimum Cash Balance required, and (vi) the lenders consented to the issuance of preferred stock and warrants (see Note&#160;11,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Redeemable Convertible Preferred Stock
</FONT>
	).&nbsp;&nbsp;The Credit Agreement consists of a term loan totaling $70.0&#160;million with a maturity of five years, at an interest rate equal to LIBOR plus 10.64%.&nbsp;&nbsp;LIBOR has a floor of 0.25%.&nbsp;&nbsp;Principal payment obligations as a percentage of the amount initially borrowed are 3.5% per annum paid quarterly for the first two years, 5.0% for the third year and 7.5% for the remaining term with any unpaid principal balance due at maturity.&nbsp;&nbsp;The obligations under the Credit Agreement are
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	67
</P>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS;WIDTH:100%;">
<A NAME="eolPage68"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	secured by a lien on substantially all of our consolidated assets pursuant to the Pledge
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	and Security Agreement, dated as of September&#160;11, 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Under the Credit Agreement, interest and principal is payable quarterly with principal payments beginning on December&#160;31, 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;Beginning in 2016, we are obligated to make certain accelerated principal payments annually which are contingent upon: (1)&#160;the occurrence of consolidated excess cash flows, as defined in the Credit Agreement and (2) only to the extent at which such excess cash flows are above our minimum cash threshold of $12.0&#160;million.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are permitted to make additional voluntary principal payments under the Credit Agreement, but prepayments are subject to an applicable prepayment premium of:&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) 5% if prepaid during the first year, (b) 3% if prepaid during the second year and (c) 1.5% if prepaid during the third year.&nbsp;&nbsp;The first $5.0&#160;million of voluntary prepayment is not subject to any prepayment premium.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The Credit Agreement contains certain financial and non-financial covenants beginning on December&#160;31, 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial covenants are assessed quarterly and are based on Adjusted EBITDA, as defined in the Credit Agreement.&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial covenants vary each quarter and generally become more restrictive over time.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Financial covenants include the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#160;
</P>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	1.24 : 1.00 to
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	1.59 : 1.00
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CFF0FC" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PT;WIDTH:1.14%;">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" BGCOLOR="#CFF0FC" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PT;WIDTH:10.5%;">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	1.59 : 1.00
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:2PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	We are also obligated to maintain a minimum valuation ratio computed on the outstanding principal balance of our senior debt compared to the sum of our valuations of our content library and our investment in ACL.&nbsp;&nbsp;To the extent the valuation ratio exceeds the allowed threshold; we are obligated to make an additional principal payment such that the threshold would not be exceeded after giving effect to this payment.&nbsp;&nbsp;The valuation threshold is 83% as long as the unpaid principal balance exceeds $65.0 million and 75% thereafter.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The Credit Agreement contains events of default that include, among others, non-payment of principal, interest or fees, violation of covenants, inaccuracy of representations and warranties, bankruptcy and insolvency events, material judgments, cross defaults to certain other contracts (including, for example, business arrangements with our U.S. distribution facilitation partner and other material contracts) and indebtedness and events constituting a change of control or a material adverse effect in any of our results of operations or conditions (financial or otherwise).&nbsp;&nbsp;The occurrence of an event of default would increase the applicable rate of interest and could result in the acceleration of our obligations under the Credit Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The Credit Agreement imposes restrictions on such items as encumbrances and liens, payments of dividends, other indebtedness, stock repurchases, capital expenditures and entering into new lease obligations.&nbsp;&nbsp;Additional covenants restrict our ability to make certain investments, such as loans and equity investments, or investments in content that are not in the ordinary course of business.&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant to the Credit Agreement, we must maintain at all times a cash balance of $1.0 million.&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December&#160;31, 2015, we were in compliance with all covenants as stipulated in the Credit Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	When repaying the previous credit facility on September 11, 2014, we recognized a $1.5 million loss from the early extinguishment of debt, which is reported separately within our statement of operations.&nbsp;&nbsp;This loss primarily represents the unamortized debt discount and deferred financing costs at the time of repayment of our prior credit facility.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:18PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Subordinated Notes Payable
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<A NAME="RLJE-10K_20151231_HTM__AEIOULASTRENDEREDPAGEBREAKAEIOU67">
</A>
	In October 2012, we issued unsecured subordinated promissory notes in the aggregate principal amount of $14.8&#160;million to the selling preferred stockholders of Image (or
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Subordinated Note Holders
</FONT>
	).&nbsp;&nbsp;The subordinated promissory notes mature on the earlier of October 3, 2018 or six months after the latest stated maturity of the senior debt issued pursuant to the Credit Agreement.&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	68
</P>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS;WIDTH:100%;">
<A NAME="eolPage69"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	unsecured subordinated promissory notes currently bear an interest rate of 1.5% per annum, of which 45% is payable in cash annually and the balance is accrued and added to the principal, which is paya
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	ble upon maturity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	During the second quarter of 2014, interest was due of $1.8 million of which $992,000 was added to the principal balance of these notes and the remainder was paid to the Subordinated Note Holders.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	On April&#160;15, 2015, we entered into an agreement to amend the subordinated promissory notes (the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Note Amendment
</FONT>
	) that were issued to the Subordinated Note Holders.&nbsp;&nbsp;The principal terms of the Note Amendment are as follows:

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	(a)

	an agreement by the Subordinated Note Holders to convert 50% of the outstanding principal and accrued interest balance under the subordinated notes into shares of preferred stock and warrants;

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	(b)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	amendments to the subordinated notes (i) changing the interest rate payable from 12% to 1.5% per annum for the 24&#8209;month period commencing on January 1, 2015, and then 12% per annum thereafter; and (ii)&#160;specifying that 45% of the interest due will be payable in cash and the remainder of the accrued interest will be payable in the form of additional subordinated notes; and
</P>

</TABLE>

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">

	&nbsp;

	a waiver of any existing defaults and events of default.
</P>

</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	We are providing interest expense on our subordinated notes payable using the effective interest rate method at an annual interest rate of approximately 5%.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	In connection with the sale of preferred stock and warrants, the Subordinated Note Holders exchanged approximately $8.5&#160;million of subordinated notes for 8,546 shares of preferred stock and 2,563,873 warrants (see Note&#160;12,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Stock Warrants
</FONT>
	).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:10.27%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Note 11.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	REDEEMABLE CONVERTIBLE PREFERRED STOCK
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	On May 20, 2015, we closed a transaction in which we sold 31,046 shares of preferred stock and warrants to acquire 9,313,873 shares of common stock for $22.5 million in cash and the exchange of $8.5 million in subordinated notes.&nbsp;&nbsp;Of the preferred shares and warrants sold, 16,500 shares of preferred stock and warrants to acquire 4,950,000 shares of common stock were sold to certain board members or their affiliated companies.&nbsp;&nbsp;We used $10.0 million of the cash proceeds from this sale to make partial payment on our Credit Agreement and approximately $1.9 million for prepayment penalties, legal and accounting fees, which include fees associated with our registration statement filed in July 2015 and other expenses associated with the transaction.&nbsp;&nbsp;The balance of the net cash proceeds was used for content investment and working capital purposes.&nbsp;&nbsp;Of the fees incurred, $878,000 was recorded against the proceeds received, $450,000 was recorded as additional debt discounts, $250,000 was included as interest expense and the balance was included in other expense.&nbsp;&nbsp;There were no shares of preferred stock issued or outstanding at December&#160;31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The preferred stock has the following rights and preferences:
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	Rank
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	&#8211; the preferred stock ranks higher than other company issued equity securities in terms of distributions, dividends and other payments upon liquidation.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">

</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	Dividends
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	&#8211; the preferred stock is entitled to cumulative dividends at a rate of 8% per annum of a preferred share&#8217;s stated value ($1,000 per share plus any unpaid dividends).&nbsp;&nbsp;The first dividend payment is due July 1, 2017 and then payments are to be made quarterly thereafter.&nbsp;&nbsp;At our discretion, dividend payments are payable in either cash or common stock, or added to the preferred share&#8217;s stated value.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	Conversion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	&#8211; at the preferred stockholder&#8217;s discretion, each share of preferred stock is convertible into 1,000 shares of our common stock, subject to adjustment for any unpaid dividends.&nbsp;&nbsp;The conversion rate is subject to anti-dilution protection including adjustments for offerings consummated at a per-share price of less than $1.00 per common share.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	Mandatory Redemption
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	&#8211; unless previously converted, on May 20, 2020, at our option we will either redeem the preferred stock with (a) cash equal to $1,000 per share plus any unpaid dividends (Redemption Value), or (b) shares of common stock determined by dividing the Redemption Value by a conversion rate equal to the lower of (i) the conversion rate then in effect (which is currently $1.00) or (ii) 85% of the then trading price, as defined, of our common stock.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	If we were to redeem with shares of common stock, the number of shares that would be issued upon redemption is not determinable as the number is contingent upon the then trading price of our common stock.&nbsp;&nbsp;Generally, if we were to redeem with shares, the number of common shares needed for redemption increases as our common stock price decreases.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	Voting
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	&#8211; except for certain matters that require the approval of the preferred stockholders, such as changes to the rights and preferences of the preferred stock, the preferred stock does not have voting rights.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, the holders of the preferred stock are entitled to appoint two board members and, under certain circumstances, appoint a third member.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	69
</P>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS;WIDTH:100%;">
<A NAME="eolPage70"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<A NAME="RLJE-10K_20151231_HTM__AEIOULASTRENDEREDPAGEBREAKAEIOU68">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	We are increasing (or accreting) the carrying balance of our preferred stock up to its redemption value using the effective interest-rate method.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="COLOR:#000000;">
	During the years ended December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, we recognized a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="COLOR:#000000;">
	ccretion of $2.6&#160;million and zero, respectively
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	, which includes cumulative preferred dividends of $1.6&#160;million (or $50.60 per share of preferred stock)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="COLOR:#000000;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	In connection with the sale, the holders of the preferred stock appointed two board members temporarily increasing the board to 11 members.&nbsp;&nbsp;On June&#160;4, 2015, four board members resigned thus reducing the board size to seven members, which we committed to when issuing the preferred stock.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The warrants issued with the preferred stock have a term of five years and an exercise price of $1.50 per share.&nbsp;&nbsp;The exercise price is subject to standard anti-dilution protection including adjustments for offerings consummated at a per-share price of less than $1.50 per common share.&nbsp;&nbsp;Additionally, if we were to consummate certain fundamental transactions, such as a business combination or other change-in-control transactions, the warrant holders may require, under certain conditions, that we repurchase the warrants with cash equal to the warrants&#8217; then fair value as determined using the Black Scholes valuation model.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	On July 9, 2015, we filed a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission to register the shares issuable upon conversion of the preferred stock and exercise of the warrants.&nbsp;&nbsp;The registration statement was declared effective in July 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;We will use our best efforts to keep the registration statement effective.&nbsp;&nbsp;If we are in default of the registration rights agreement, and as long as the event of default is not cured, then we are required to pay, in cash, partial liquidation damages, which in total are not to exceed 6% of the aggregated subscription amount of $31.0&#160;million.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are accreting the carrying value of our preferred stock up to its redemption value over a period of time beginning from the issuance on May&#160;20, 2015 to the required redemption date of May&#160;20, 2020.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#160;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:2PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	We issued warrants with a term of five years beginning October 3, 2012 that provide the warrant holder the right to acquire a share of our common stock for $12.00 per share (the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	2012 Warrants
</FONT>
	).&nbsp;&nbsp;The warrants are redeemable by us for $0.01 per warrant share if our common stock trades at $17.50 or more per share for 20 out of 30 trading days. The warrants contain standard anti-dilution provisions.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The 2012 Warrants contain a provision whereby the exercise price will be reduced if RLJE reorganized as a private company.&nbsp;&nbsp;The reduction in exercise price depends upon the amount of other consideration, if any, received by the warrant holders in the reorganization and how many years after the Business Combination reorganization is consummated.&nbsp;&nbsp;Generally, the reduction in exercise price would be between $6.00 and $9.00 assuming no additional consideration was received.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	On May 20, 2015, we issued warrants to acquire 9.3 million shares of our common stock (the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	2015 Warrants
</FONT>
	).&nbsp;&nbsp;The terms are described in Note 11,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Redeemable Convertible Preferred Stock
</FONT>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:10.27%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	NOTE 13.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	EQUITY
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Our articles of incorporation authorize us to issue up to 250 million shares of common stock and one million shares of preferred stock, par value $0.001 per share.&nbsp;&nbsp;At December 31, 2015, there were 14,151,519 shares of common stock issued and outstanding.&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December 31, 2014, there were 13,724,756 shares issued and 13,335,258 shares outstanding.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<A NAME="RLJE-10K_20151231_HTM__AEIOULASTRENDEREDPAGEBREAKAEIOU69">
</A>
	On October 3, 2012, in connection with the consummation of the Business Combination, RLJE and certain Image and Acorn Media selling shareholders entered into an amended and restated registration rights agreement (the &#8220;Registration Rights Agreement&#8221;),
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	70
</P>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS;WIDTH:100%;">
<A NAME="eolPage71"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	in wh
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	ich RLJE agreed to use its best efforts to register certain of its securities held by the stockholders who are a party to the Registration Rights Agreement under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the &#8220;Securities Act&#8221;).&nbsp;&nbsp;Such stockholders are entitled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	to make up to three demands, excluding short form registration demands, that RLJE register certain of its securities held by them for sale under the Securities Act.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, such stockholders have the right to include their securities in other regist
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	ration statements filed by RLJE.&nbsp;&nbsp;At December&#160;31, 2015, no demand had been received.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Included in our common shares outstanding at December 31, 2014 were 437,241 shares held by certain founding shareholders as part of the initial public offering of RLJE.&nbsp;&nbsp;These shares were subject to forfeiture over a two-year period if certain stock price targets were not achieved.&nbsp;&nbsp;All shares were forfeited and returned in January 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	As shares are forfeited, they become treasury shares.&nbsp;&nbsp;Forfeiture of shares occurs when directors or employees resign or stop working for us prior to achieving vesting conditions for certain stock-based compensation awards, when performance conditions are not met regardless of continued employment or service or when Sponsor shares are returned to us as discussed above.&nbsp;&nbsp;Treasury shares are available to RLJE for future grants or issuances of shares at our discretion.&nbsp;&nbsp;At December 31, 2015, we did not hold any treasury shares.&nbsp;&nbsp;At December 31, 2014, we held 389,498 shares of common stock in treasury.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:10.27%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Note 14.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Stock-Based Compensation
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Equity Compensation Plan
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	As of December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, we had one equity compensation plan.&nbsp;&nbsp;The 2012 Incentive Compensation Plan of RLJ Entertainment, Inc. (the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Incentive Plan
</FONT>
	) was approved by the shareholders of RLJ Acquisition, Image and Acorn Media on September&#160;20, 2012.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Incentive Plan is administered by the compensation committee of our Board of Directors.&nbsp;&nbsp;On December&#160;4, 2015, our stockholders approved an amendment to the Incentive Plan whereby the compensation committee may grant awards totaling a maximum of 6,244,153 shares.&nbsp;&nbsp;The compensation committee may award options, stock appreciation rights, restricted stock awards, restricted stock unit awards, bonus stock and awards in lieu of obligations, dividend equivalents, performance awards and other stock-based awards (as those terms are defined in the Incentive Plan).&nbsp;&nbsp;No person may be granted (i) options or stock appreciation rights with respect to more than 750,000 shares or (ii) restricted stock, restricted stock units, performance shares and/or other stock-based awards with respect to more than 750,000 shares.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, no person may be granted awards worth more than $1.0 million of grant date fair value with respect to any 12-month Performance Period (as that term is defined in the Incentive Plan) or $2.0 million with respect to any Performance Period that is more than 12 months.&nbsp;&nbsp;The maximum term allowed for an option is 10 years and a stock award shall either vest or be forfeited not more than 10 years from the date of grant.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	At December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, there were 4,534,166 and 787,668 shares, respectively, available for future grants under the Incentive Plan.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Restricted Stock-Based Compensation Grants
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Compensation expense relating to the restricted stock awards for the years ended December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014 was $310,000 and $769,000, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;Unrecognized stock-based compensation expense relating to these restricted stock awards of approximately $843,000 at December&#160;31, 2015 is expected to be expensed ratably over the remaining vesting period through October 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;The weighted average remaining vesting period for non-vested shares is six months.&nbsp;&nbsp;Compensation expense related to restricted stock awards is included in general and administrative expenses.&nbsp;&nbsp;On June&#160;30, 2015, we allowed 57,224 shares of common stock to vest that were granted to those board members who resigned on June 4, 2015 (see Note 11,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Redeemable Convertible Preferred Stock).&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
	We accounted for this as a modification of vesting provisions and revalued these shares as of June&#160;30, 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;This revaluation resulted in a reduction in share-based compensation expense of $146,000 during the year ended December&#160;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	During the year ended December 31, 2015, 1,304,248 shares of restricted common stock were granted.&nbsp;&nbsp;Of the 1,304,248 shares granted, 476,005 shares were granted to executive officers and directors and 828,243 shares were granted to other members of management.&nbsp;&nbsp;The shares were fair valued using our closing stock price on the date of grant with a range of $0.69 to $1.22 per share, for a total value of approximately $1.0 million.&nbsp;&nbsp;These restricted shares will vest and be expensed over a one-year period as a component of general and administrative expenses.&nbsp;&nbsp;The vesting of restricted shares is subject to the achievement of certain service criteria, qualitative performance criteria, or both.&nbsp;&nbsp;The amount of expense recognized to date has been reduced by estimated forfeitures related to certain performance targets that are not likely to be achieved.&nbsp;&nbsp;The restricted stock may be subject to further forfeitures if the employee or director terminates his or her service during the vesting period or future performance measures are not achieved.&nbsp;&nbsp;All shares of restricted stock participate in dividends, if declared prior to their vesting date.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	71
</P>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS;WIDTH:100%;">

	&nbsp;
</P>

	Restricted stock award activity under the Incentive Plan for the year ended December&#160;31, 2015, and changes during the year then ended are presented
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	below:
</FONT>

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	During the year ended December 31, 2014, 190,280 shares of restricted common stock were granted, 182,206 shares were vested and 93,742 shares were forfeited.&nbsp;&nbsp;Of the 190,280 shares granted, 164,780 shares were granted to executive officers and directors and 25,500 shares were granted to other members of management.&nbsp;&nbsp;Of the shares forfeited, 65,297 shares of restricted stock were forfeited based upon the failure to achieve the required performance conditions and the remainder of the forfeitures were due to employee resignations.&nbsp;&nbsp;The shares granted in 2014 were fair valued on the date of grant with a range of $3.49 to $5.00 per share, for a total value of approximately $766,000.&nbsp;&nbsp;These restricted shares will vest and be expensed over a three-year period for executive management and other management while restricted shares granted to directors vest and are expensed over a one-year period as a component of general and administrative expenses.&nbsp;&nbsp;The vesting of restricted shares is subject to the achievement of certain service criteria, qualitative performance criteria, or both.&nbsp;&nbsp;The amount of expense recognized to date has been reduced by estimated forfeitures related to certain performance targets that are not likely to be achieved.&nbsp;&nbsp;The restricted stock may be subject to further forfeitures if the employee or director terminates his or her service during the vesting period or future performance measures are not achieved.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Restricted stock award activity under the Incentive Plan for the year ended December&#160;31, 2014, and changes during the year then ended are presented below:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;WIDTH:1%; BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID 0.75PT TRANSPARENT;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">

</P>
