</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:2PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:10.27%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Note 15.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Fair Value Measurements
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Warrant Liability
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Stock Warrant and Other Derivative Liabilities
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	We have warrants outstanding to purchase 30,355,540 shares of our common stock, which are recorded at fair value on the consolidated balance sheets.&nbsp;&nbsp;We issued the 2012 Warrants to purchase 21,041,667 shares of our common stock in 2012 and we issued the 2015 Warrants to purchase 9,313,873 shares of our common stock in 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<A NAME="RLJE-10K_20151231_HTM__AEIOULASTRENDEREDPAGEBREAKAEIOU71">
</A>
	Of the 2012 Warrants, 15,375,000 are registered under the Securities Act and are available for trading on the over-the-counter market.&nbsp;&nbsp;Since the first quarter of 2014, there has been a lack of trading activity for the registered warrants, and as such, when assessing their fair value we transferred them from Level 1 to Level 3 within the fair-value hierarchy.&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, we determined the fair value of the registered warrants using a Monte Carlo simulation model. Inputs to the model are stock volatility, contractual warrant terms (which are remaining life of the warrant, the redemption feature, the exercise price, and assumptions for the reduction in exercise price if we were to reorganize as a private company), the risk-free interest rate, and a discount for the lack of marketability (DLOM) pertaining to the underlying common stock as the shares acquirable are not registered.&nbsp;&nbsp;We use the closing market price of our common stock to compute stock volatility.&nbsp;&nbsp;The DLOM is determined using the Finnerty Average-Strike Put Option Marketability Discount Model (Finnerty Model), which takes into consideration the discount period, stock dividend rates, and stock volatility.&nbsp;&nbsp;We used a DLOM rate of 19.0% as of December&#160;31, 2015 and 11.2% as of December&#160;31, 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	72
</P>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS;WIDTH:100%;">
<A NAME="eolPage73"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Assumptions regarding adjustments to the exercise price are based on management&#8217;s best estimates of the likelihood of reorganizing as a private company and the amount of the resulting exercise-price adjustment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The remaining 2012 Warrants, consisting of Sponsor warrants of 3,816,667 and unregistered warrants of 1,850,000, are classified as Level 3 within the fair-value hierarchy.&nbsp;&nbsp;Because RLJE has agreed not to exercise its redemption right pertaining to certain warrants held by RLJ SPAC Acquisition LLC (or
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	the Sponsor
</FONT>
	) and because the unregistered warrants generally have a discounted fair value as compared to the registered warrants, the valuation of the sponsor warrants and the unregistered warrants has always been a Level 3 measurement.&nbsp;&nbsp;We determined the fair value of the Sponsor warrants using a Monte Carlo simulation model and using the same assumptions used for the registered warrants, except we did not include the redemption feature.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The unregistered 2012 Warrants differ from the registered warrants in that they have not been registered under the Securities Act and are not available for trading.&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December&#160;31, 2015 and December&#160;31, 2014, we determined the fair value of these warrants by taking the fair value of a registered warrant and discounting it using the Finnerty Model for the lack of marketability as these warrants are not registered.&nbsp;&nbsp;We used a DLOM rate of 25.0% as of December&#160;31, 2015 and 17.8% as of December&#160;31, 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;The 2012 Warrants decreased in fair value from $601,000 as of December&#160;31, 2014 to $36,000 as of December&#160;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	We are using a lattice model to value the 2015 Warrants, which are classified as Level 3 within the fair-value hierarchy.&nbsp;&nbsp;Inputs to the model are stock volatility, contractual warrant terms (which are remaining life of the warrant and the exercise price), the risk-free interest rate and management&#8217;s assessment of the likelihood of doing a down-round transaction.&nbsp;&nbsp;We use the closing market price of our common stock to compute stock volatility.&nbsp;&nbsp;The 2015 Warrants increased in fair value since issuance from $2.1&#160;million as of May&#160;20, 2015 to $2.2&#160;million as of December&#160;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	We are using the lattice model to value the preferred stock&#8217;s embedded conversion feature, which is classified as Level 3 within the fair-value hierarchy.&nbsp;&nbsp;Inputs to the model are stock volatility, contractual terms (which are remaining life of the conversion option and the conversion rate), the risk-free interest rate and management&#8217;s assessment of the likelihood of doing a down-round transaction.&nbsp;&nbsp;We use the closing market price of our common stock to compute stock volatility.&nbsp;&nbsp;The fair value of the embedded conversion feature decreased since issuance from $9.4 million as of May 20, 2015 to $8.4 million as of December&#160;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The following tables represent the valuation of our warrant and other derivative liabilities within the fair-value hierarchy:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#160;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#160;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Investments in Content
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	When events and circumstances indicate that investments in content are impaired, we determine the fair value of the investment; and if the fair value is less than the carrying amount, we recognize additional amortization expense equal to the excess.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our non&#8209;recurring fair value measurement information of assets and liabilities is classified in the tables below:
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">

</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:1PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&nbsp;

</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:2PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	During the years ended December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, the investments in content were impaired by $3.2 million and $4.8&#160;million, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;In determining the fair value of our investments in content, we employ a DCF methodology.&nbsp;&nbsp;Key inputs employed in the DCF methodology include estimates of a film's ultimate revenue and costs as well as a discount rate.&nbsp;&nbsp;The discount rate utilized in the DCF analysis is based on our weighted average cost of capital plus a risk premium representing the risk associated with producing a particular film or television program.&nbsp;&nbsp;As the primary determination of fair value is determined using a DCF model, the resulting fair value is considered a Level 3 measurement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:2PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	We have outstanding warrants to acquire 30,355,540 shares of common stock that are not included in the computation of diluted net loss per common share as the effect would be anti-dilutive because their exercise prices which range from $1.50 to $12.00 per share exceed the fair value of our common stock.&nbsp;&nbsp;For the years ended December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, we have weighted average outstanding shares of approximately 36,000 and 613,000, respectively, which are held by founding shareholders that were forfeited in January 2015 (See Note 13,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Equity
</FONT>
	), that are not included in the computation of basic or diluted net loss per share as the effect would be anti-dilutive.&nbsp;&nbsp;For the years ended December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, we have weighted average outstanding shares of approximately 234,000 and 923,000 shares, respectively, of compensatory restricted common stock, that are not included in the computation of basic and diluted net loss per share as the effect would be anti-dilutive.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	74
</P>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS;WIDTH:100%;">
<A NAME="eolPage75"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:10.27%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Note 17.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Income Taxes&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	RLJE files income tax returns in the U.S. Federal jurisdiction and various state jurisdictions. Our subsidiaries in the United Kingdom and Australia continue to file income tax returns in their foreign jurisdictions.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Income taxes are accounted for under the asset and liability method.&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferred tax assets and liabilities are recognized for the future tax consequences attributable to differences between the financial statement carrying amounts of existing assets and liabilities and their respective tax bases and operating loss and tax credit carryforwards.&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferred tax assets and liabilities are measured using enacted tax rates expected to apply to taxable income in the years in which those temporary differences are expected to be recovered or settled.&nbsp;&nbsp;We must assess the likelihood that our deferred tax assets will be recovered from future taxable income and, to the extent that it is more likely than not that such deferred tax assets will not be realized, we must establish a valuation allowance.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	As of December&#160;31, 2015, we have a valuation allowance against 100% of our deferred tax assets, which are composed primarily of net operating loss (or
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	NOL
</FONT>
	) carryforwards that were either acquired in the Business Combination or generated in the years following.&nbsp;&nbsp;Even though we have reserved all of these net deferred tax assets for book purposes, we would still be able to utilize them to reduce future income taxes payable should we have future taxable earnings.&nbsp;&nbsp;To the extent our deferred tax assets relate to NOL carryforwards, the ability to use such NOLs against future earnings will be subject to applicable carryforward periods.&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December&#160;31, 2015, we had NOL carryforwards for Federal and state tax purposes of approximately $87.3&#160;million and approximately $59.6&#160;million, respectively, which are available to offset taxable income through 2035.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our NOL carryforwards begin to expire in 2017.&nbsp;&nbsp;NOL carryforwards that were acquired in the Business Combination reflect our assessment of an annual limitation on the utilization of these carryforwards due to ownership change limitations as required by Section 382 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the &#8220;Code&#8221;), as well as similar state limitations.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Income tax expense is summarized below:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#160;
</P>

	Loss before provision for income taxes is as follows:

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PT;PADDING-RIGHT:0.75PT;PADDING-TOP:0.75PT;WIDTH:66.98%; BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID 0.75PT TRANSPARENT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	(In thousands)
</P>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:2PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<A NAME="RLJE-10K_20151231_HTM__AEIOULASTRENDEREDPAGEBREAKAEIOU73">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The tax effects of temporary differences that give rise to a significant portion of the net deferred tax assets and liabilities are presented below:
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:2PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Our significant tax returns are filed in the following jurisdictions:&nbsp;&nbsp;United States, United Kingdom and in the following states:&nbsp;&nbsp;Maryland and California.&nbsp;&nbsp;The tax years for 2009 through 2015 remain open to examination.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are not currently under examination by any of the jurisdictions where we file significant tax returns.&nbsp;&nbsp;We believe that our tax filing positions and deductions will be sustained if audited and we do not anticipate any adjustments that would result in a material adverse effect on our financial condition, results of operations, or cash flow.&nbsp;&nbsp;Therefore, no reserves for uncertain tax positions have been recorded.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	76
</P>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:10.27%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	NOTE 19.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	SEVERANCE
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	During the year ended December&#160;31, 2014, we incurred severance charges of $548,000 as part of the implemented reorganization from the formation of RLJE with former employees.&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended December&#160;31, 2015, we recognized additional severance charges of $574,000 associated with this reorganization.&nbsp;&nbsp;These charges were recorded as a component of general and administrative expense.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:10.27%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Note 20.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Employee Benefits
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Effective October 3, 2012, we established the RLJ Entertainment 401(k) Plan, a defined contribution 401(k) plan for the benefit of employees meeting certain eligibility requirements.&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the plan, participants may contribute a portion of their earnings on a pre-tax basis.&nbsp;&nbsp;Employee contributions are forwarded to the plan administrator and invested in various funds at the discretion of the employee.&nbsp;&nbsp;RLJE matches a portion of those contributions based upon the employee&#8217;s compensation status in accordance with the U.S. Internal Revenue Code.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our U.S. sponsor plan contributes up to four percent depending on the employee&#8217;s contribution beginning one month after the date of hire.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our U.K. and Australia subsidiaries sponsor plans contribute between three to seven percent and nine percent, respectively, to employees beginning after a probationary period of three months to one year.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	During the years ended December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014,
<FONT STYLE="COLOR:#000000;">
	we incurred compensation expenses related to these plans of $578,000 and $539,000, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	77
</P>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS;WIDTH:100%;">

	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:10.27%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Note 21.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">

	Operating Leases
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	RLJE&#8217;s principal executive office is located in Silver Spring, Maryland.&nbsp;&nbsp;We also maintain offices in Woodland Hills, California; Stillwater, Minnesota; London, England and Sydney, Australia with varying terms and expiration dates.&nbsp;&nbsp;All locations are leased.&nbsp;&nbsp;A summary of our locations is as follows:

<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:2PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Rent expense was $1.9 million and 2.0 million, for the years ended December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Employment Agreements
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	At December&#160;31, 2015, our future contractual obligations under four employment agreements are summarized below.&nbsp;&nbsp;Included in the amounts below are any minimum bonus or agreed-upon amounts to be paid within the employment contracts over the next five years as long as the employee continues to be an employee in good standing and meets the performance criteria within the individual employment agreements.&nbsp;&nbsp;One of the four employment agreements does not have an expiration date and is included in each of the five years presented below.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">

<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS;WIDTH:100%;">
<A NAME="eolPage79"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:8PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<A NAME="RLJE-10K_20151231_HTM__AEIOULASTRENDEREDPAGEBREAKAEIOU76">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Future Royalty Obligations
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;COLOR:#000000;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	At December&#160;31, 2015, our future obligations for royalty advances, minimum royalty guarantees and exclusive distribution fee guarantees under the terms of our existing licenses and exclusive distribution agreements that have an off balance sheet commitment total $10.5 million.&nbsp;&nbsp;To the extent payment is not due until delivery has occurred, these commitments will be recognized in 2016 within our consolidated financial statements upon the earlier of payment or upon delivery of content by the content supplier.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:18PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Legal Proceedings
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	In the normal course of business, we are subject to proceedings, lawsuits and other claims, including proceedings under government laws and regulations relating to content ownership and copyright matters.&nbsp;&nbsp;While it is not possible to predict the outcome of these matters, it is the opinion of management, based on consultations with legal counsel, that the ultimate disposition of known proceedings will not have a material adverse impact on our financial position, results of operations or liquidity.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:10.27%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	NOTE 22.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Equity Investments in Affiliate
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	We charged ACL overhead and personnel costs for the years ended December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, of approximately $1.0&#160;million and $2.3 million, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;Amounts were recorded as a reduction in general and administrative expenses in the accompanying consolidated statements of operations.&nbsp;&nbsp;During 2015, ACL began incurring most of their personnel and related support costs directly opposed to these costs being incurred by us and then charged to ACL.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	ACL paid dividends to RLJE Ltd. of $3.3 million and $4.0 million during the years ended December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;Dividends received were recorded as a reduction to the ACL investment account.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	We have advanced ACL $2.6 million for distribution rights for
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Partners in Crime
</FONT>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;During the third quarter of 2015, we received the title from ACL and began distributing it with third parties.&nbsp;&nbsp;For the year ended December&#160;31, 2015, we recognized content amortization and royalty expense of $1.7 million, which is included in our cost of goods sold as content amortization and royalties.&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December&#160;31, 2015, our remaining unamortized content advance is $0.9 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	During 2015, we paid $120,000 of the $300,000 advance due to ACL for distribution rights for
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	And Then There Were None
</FONT>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The remaining advance was paid in February 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;There was no content amortization and royalty expense recognized in 2015 as the title was not released until 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:18PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Foreign Currency
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	We recognize foreign currency gains and losses, as a component of other expense, on amounts lent by Acorn Media to RLJE&#160;Ltd. and RLJE Australia.&#160; As of December&#160;31, 2015, Acorn Media had lent its U.K. subsidiaries approximately $8.5&#160;million and its Australian subsidiary approximately $3.4 million.&#160; Amounts lent will be repaid in U.S. dollars based on available cash.&nbsp;&nbsp;Movement in exchange rates between the U.S. dollar and the functional currencies (which are the British Pound Sterling and the Australian dollar) of those subsidiaries that were lent the monies will result in foreign currency gains and losses.&nbsp;&nbsp;During the years ended December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, we recognized foreign currency losses of $1.1 million and $1.1 million, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:18PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The RLJ Companies, LLC
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	On June 27, 2013, The RLJ Companies, LLC (whose sole manager and voting member is the chairman of our board of directors) purchased from one of our vendors $3.5 million of contract obligations that we owed to the vendor.&nbsp;&nbsp;These obligation were payable by us to the vendor through September&#160;5, 2013.&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant to the purchase, The RLJ Companies, LLC has become the account creditor with respect to these accounts.&nbsp;&nbsp;These accounts have not been otherwise modified.&nbsp;&nbsp;These purchased liabilities are included in accrued royalties and distribution fees in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets as of December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:18PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	RLJ SPAC Acquisition, LLC
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The chairman of our board of directors, Mr. Robert L. Johnson, through his company,
<FONT STYLE="COLOR:#000000;">
	RLJ SPAC Acquisition,&#160;LLC
</FONT>
	announced his intention to purchase up to $2.0 million of our outstanding common stock from time to time over a 24-month period beginning June 19, 2013.&nbsp;&nbsp;From June 2013 through January 2015, $1.7 million of common stock was purchased under this plan, which expired with an unused balance in June 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;All purchases were made
<FONT STYLE="COLOR:#000000;">
	at the discretion of Lazard Capital Markets LLC in the open market or in privately negotiated transactions in compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	79
</P>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS;WIDTH:100%;">
<A NAME="eolPage80"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<A NAME="RLJE-10K_20151231_HTM__AEIOULASTRENDEREDPAGEBREAKAEIOU77">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	During the years ended December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, RLJ SP
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	AC Acquisition LLC purchased 3,100 and 128,665 shares, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:18PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Sale of Preferred Stock and Warrants
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	On May 20, 2015, certain former board members and their affiliate companies, including RLJ SPAC Acquisition,&#160;LLC, purchased 16,500 shares of preferred stock and warrants to acquire 4,950,000 share of common stock from us for $16.5&#160;million.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;

<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:10.27%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:18PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	ITEM 9A.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:18PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A NAME="RLJE-10K_20151231_HTM_ITEM_9A_CONTROLS_PROCEDURES">
</A>
<A NAME="RLJE-10K_20151231_HTM_ITEM_9A_CONTROLS_PROCEDURES">
</A>
	CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Disclosure Controls and Procedures
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	We maintain disclosure controls and procedures that are designed to ensure that information required to be disclosed in the reports that we file or submit under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (or
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Exchange Act
</FONT>
	), is recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the time periods specified in the SEC&#8217;s rules and forms, and that such information is accumulated and communicated to our management, including our principal executive and principal financial officers, or persons performing similar functions, as appropriate to allow timely decisions regarding required disclosure.&nbsp;&nbsp;We periodically review the design and effectiveness of our disclosure controls and internal control over financial reporting.&nbsp;&nbsp;We make modifications to improve the design and effectiveness of our disclosure controls and internal control structure, and may take other corrective action, if our reviews identify a need for such modifications or actions.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	As of the end of the period covered by this Annual Report
<FONT STYLE="COLOR:#000000;">
	on Form 10-K for the year ended December&#160;31, 2015 (or&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Annual&#160;Report
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="COLOR:#000000;">
	)
</FONT>
	, we evaluated, under the supervision and with the participation of our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Accounting Officer, the effectiveness of our disclosure controls and procedures. Based on that evaluation, our Chief Executive Officer and our Chief Accounting Officer have concluded that our disclosure controls and procedures were not effective as of the end of the period covered by this Annual Report because of material weaknesses in our internal controls over financial reporting, relating to the review of content ultimates and the preparation and review of reconciliations, which we view as an integral part of our disclosure controls and procedures.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:18PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Internal Control Over Financial Reporting
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Management&#8217;s Annual Report on Internal Control Over Financial Reporting
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Our management is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting for our Company.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our internal control over financial reporting is a process designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of our financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with United States generally accepted accounting principles.&nbsp;&nbsp;Internal control over financial reporting includes policies and procedures that:
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:6.3%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	Concern the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of our assets;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:6.3%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	Provide reasonable assurance that (a)&#160;transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles and (b)&#160;that our receipts and expenditures are being recorded and made only in accordance with management&#8217;s authorizations;&#160;and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:6.3%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:'SYMBOL';FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
	Provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use or disposition of our assets.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	A control system, no matter how well designed and operated, can provide only reasonable, not absolute, assurance that the objectives of the control system are met.&nbsp;&nbsp;Because of the inherent limitations, internal controls over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements.&nbsp;&nbsp;Projections of any evaluation of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting to future periods are subject to the risks that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Management conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting at December&#160;31, 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;In conducting this evaluation, management used the criteria set forth by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission in
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Internal Control&#8212;Integrated Framework&#8211; 1992
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;COLOR:#000000;">
	and identified material weaknesses in our internal control over financial reporting as of December&#160;31, 2015 as defined in SEC Regulation&#160;S-X. A material weakness is a deficiency, or combination of deficiencies, in internal control over financial reporting, such that there is a reasonable possibility that a material misstatement of the Company&#8217;s annual or interim financial statements will not be prevented or detected on a timely basis.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
</FONT>
	As a result of the material weaknesses described below, management concluded that, at December&#160;31, 2015, our internal control over financial reporting was ineffective.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	81
</P>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS;WIDTH:100%;">
<A NAME="eolPage82"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<A NAME="RLJE-10K_20151231_HTM__AEIOULASTRENDEREDPAGEBREAKAEIOU79">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Management has concluded that we failed to maintain an effective control environment an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	d monitoring activities as a result of (1) an ineffective design of the process level controls associated with the review of content ultimates and (2) a failure to design or maintain effective process level controls over certain reconciliations and managem
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	ent review.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	In light of the material weaknesses, we performed the following action steps during 2015:
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:6.67%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.13%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	(a)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We improved communications between legal, operations and finance with respect to notification of expired, modified or terminated catalog content agreements to ensure they are properly evaluated within the ultimates.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:6.67%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.13%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	(b)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We implemented analytical tools to help identify ultimates that need to be reviewed and updated.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:6.67%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.13%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	(c)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We added staff to our financial reporting function to provide increased focus over content analysis and review.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:6.67%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.13%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	(d)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	During the last six months of 2015, we employed additional accounting personnel, replaced other personnel, and reorganized the corporate accounting function into one single location.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:6.67%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:6PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.17%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:6PT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	(e)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:6PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Reassigned roles and responsibilities amongst the current accounting personnel.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	While the above action steps were implemented as of December&#160;31, 2015, it will take time to properly transition roles and responsibilities, as well as provide necessary staff training.&nbsp;&nbsp;During 2016, we will be assessing the effectiveness of the changes made and make additional modifications as required.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Based upon the above changes, management believes that the financial statements included in this report fairly represent in all material aspects our Company&#8217;s financial position, results of operations and cash flows for the periods presented.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	This Annual Report does not include an attestation report of our registered public accounting firm regarding internal control over financial reporting.&nbsp;&nbsp;Management's report was not subject to attestation by our registered public accounting firm pursuant to rules that permit us to provide only management's report in this Annual Report.
</P>
</EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>

</A>
	DIRECTORS, EXECUTIVE OFFICERS AND CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	The additional information required by this Item will be included in our company&#8217;s proxy statement for its 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	We have a Code of Ethics and Business Conduct Policy that applies to all of our employees, including our principal executive officer, principal financial and principal accounting officer, and to our directors.&nbsp;&nbsp;We have posted the Code of Ethics and Business Conduct Policy under the menu &#8220;Investors &#8211; Corporate Governance&#8221; on our website at
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	www.rljentertainment.com
</FONT>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;If we waive any material portion of our Code of Ethics and Business Conduct Policy that applies to our principal executive officer, principal financial officer or principal accounting officer or amend the Code of Ethics and Business Conduct Policy (other than technical, administrative or other non-substantive amendments), we will disclose that fact on our website at
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	www.rljentertainment.com
</FONT>
	within four business days.
</P>

</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	5.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">

	The registrant's other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#8217;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#8217;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	a.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">

	All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#8217;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and

	Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#8217;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting; and

<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	a.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#8217;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	b.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

	&#160;
</P>

<EFX_EXHIBIT_32>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_32"></A>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	Exhibit 32.1
</P>
<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION_3"></A>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO 18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350, AS ADOPTED
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0%;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	PURSUANT TO SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:12PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:4.54%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	In connection with the Annual Report of RLJ Entertainment, Inc. (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) on Form 10-K for the fiscal December 31, 2015 as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the &#8220;Report&#8221;), I, Miguel Penella, Chief Executive Officer and Mark Nunis, Chief Accounting Officer of the Company, certify, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. &#167; 1350, as adopted pursuant to &#167; 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that:
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:4.54%;WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;">
	(1)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:6PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-TRANSFORM:NONE;FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Based on my knowledge, the Report fully complies with the requirements of section 13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (15 U.S.C. 78m or 78o(d)); and
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
